member.name: T:TVA.Web.Services.Messaging.MessageBusSecurityPolicy
member.summary: Represents an authorization policy that can be used for enabling role-based security on .
member.example:
This example shows the required config file entries when securing :
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <configSections> <section name="categorizedSettings" type="TVA.Configuration.CategorizedSettingsSection, TVA.Core" /> </configSections> <categorizedSettings> <securityProvider> <add name="ApplicationName" value="SEC_APP" description="Name of the application being secured as defined in the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ConnectionString" value="Primary={Server=DB1;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True};Backup={Server=DB2;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True}" description="Connection string to be used for connection to the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ProviderType" value="TVA.Security.SqlSecurityProvider, TVA.Security" description="The type to be used for enforcing security." encrypted="false" /> <add name="IncludedResources" value="Topic.Name=*;Queue.Name=*" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be secured along with role names." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ExcludedResources" value="*/mex;*/Publish;*/GetClients;*/GetQueues;*/GetTopics;*/SecurityService.svc/*" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be excluded from being secured." encrypted="false" /> </securityProvider> <activeDirectory> <add name="PrivilegedDomain" value="" description="Domain of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedUserName" value="" description="Username of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedPassword" value="" description="Password of privileged domain user account." encrypted="true" /> </activeDirectory> </categorizedSettings> </configuration>

member.name: T:TVA.Web.SecurityPolicy
member.summary: Represents an authorization policy that can be used by WCF services for enabling role-based security.
member.example:
Common config file entries:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <configSections> <section name="categorizedSettings" type="TVA.Configuration.CategorizedSettingsSection, TVA.Core" /> </configSections> <categorizedSettings> <securityProvider> <add name="ApplicationName" value="SEC_APP" description="Name of the application being secured as defined in the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ConnectionString" value="Primary={Server=DB1;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True};Backup={Server=DB2;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True}" description="Connection string to be used for connection to the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ProviderType" value="TVA.Security.SqlSecurityProvider, TVA.Security" description="The type to be used for enforcing security." encrypted="false" /> <add name="IncludedResources" value="*/*.*=*" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be secured along with role names." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ExcludedResources" value="*/SecurityService.svc/*" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be excluded from being secured." encrypted="false" /> </securityProvider> <activeDirectory> <add name="PrivilegedDomain" value="" description="Domain of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedUserName" value="" description="Username of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedPassword" value="" description="Password of privileged domain user account." encrypted="true" /> </activeDirectory> </categorizedSettings> </configuration>
Internal WCF service configuration:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <system.serviceModel> <services> <service name="WcfService1.Service1" behaviorConfiguration="serviceBehavior"> <endpoint address="" contract="WcfService1.IService1" binding="webHttpBinding" bindingConfiguration="endpointBinding" behaviorConfiguration="endpointBehavior" /> </service> </services> <behaviors> <endpointBehaviors> <behavior name="endpointBehavior"> <webHttp/> </behavior> </endpointBehaviors> <serviceBehaviors> <behavior name="serviceBehavior"> <serviceAuthorization principalPermissionMode="Custom"> <authorizationPolicies> <add policyType="TVA.Web.SecurityPolicy, TVA.Web" /> </authorizationPolicies> </serviceAuthorization> </behavior> </serviceBehaviors> </behaviors> <bindings> <webHttpBinding> <binding name="endpointBinding"> <security mode="TransportCredentialOnly"> <transport clientCredentialType="Windows"/> </security> </binding> </webHttpBinding> </bindings> <serviceHostingEnvironment aspNetCompatibilityEnabled="false" /> </system.serviceModel> </configuration>
External WCF service configuration:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <system.web> <httpModules> <add name="SecurityModule" type="TVA.Web.SecurityModule, TVA.Web" /> </httpModules> </system.web> <system.serviceModel> <services> <service name="WcfService1.Service1" behaviorConfiguration="serviceBehavior"> <endpoint address="" contract="WcfService1.IService1" binding="webHttpBinding" bindingConfiguration="endpointBinding" behaviorConfiguration="endpointBehavior"/> </service> </services> <behaviors> <endpointBehaviors> <behavior name="endpointBehavior"> <webHttp/> </behavior> </endpointBehaviors> <serviceBehaviors> <behavior name="serviceBehavior"> <serviceAuthorization principalPermissionMode="Custom"> <authorizationPolicies> <add policyType="TVA.Web.SecurityPolicy, TVA.Web" /> </authorizationPolicies> </serviceAuthorization> </behavior> </serviceBehaviors> </behaviors> <bindings> <webHttpBinding> <binding name="endpointBinding"> <security mode="None" /> </binding> </webHttpBinding> </bindings> <serviceHostingEnvironment aspNetCompatibilityEnabled="true" /> </system.serviceModel> </configuration>

member.name: T:TVA.Web.NamespaceDoc

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Hosting.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains classes that make-up the framework for serving content embedded in .NET assemblies over the web.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider
member.summary: A that allows serving pages from embedded resources.

remarks.para:
ASP.NET retrieves files to serve via the . Rather than opening a file via , you ask the for its
and ask that provider for the file. The provider will return a reference that will allow you to open a stream on the file and use the contents.

This implementation of allows you to serve files to ASP.NET through embedded resources. Rather than deploying your web forms, user controls, etc., to the file system, you can embed the files as resources right in your assembly and deploy just your assembly. The mechanism will take care of the rest.
remarks.note: Most implementations handle both directories and files. This implementation handles only files. As such, if the is used to enumerate available files (as in directory browsing), files provided via embedded resource will not be included.
remarks.para: To use this , you need to do four things to your web application.

First, you need to set all of the files you want to serve from your assembly as embedded resources. By default, web forms and so forth are set as "content" files; setting them as embedded resources will package them into your assembly.

Second, in your AssemblyInfo.cs file (or whichever file you are declaring your assembly attributes in) you need to add one for every file you plan on serving. This lets the provider know which embedded resources are available and which are actually resources for other purposes. Your assembly attributes will look something like this:
Third, you need to register this provider at application startup so ASP.NET knows to use it. In your Global.asax, during Application_OnStart, put the following:

Fourth, in your web.config file, you need to set up a configuration section called embeddedFileAssemblies that lets the provider know which assemblies should be queried for embedded files. A sample configuration section looks like this:

Once you have that set up, you're ready to serve files from embedded resources. Simply deploy your application without putting the embedded resource files into the filesystem. When you visit the embedded locations, the provider will automatically retrieve the proper embedded resource.

File paths are mapped into the application using the
declarations and the method. This allows you to set up your web application as normal in Visual Studio and the folder structure, which automatically generates namespaces for your embedded resources, will translate into virtual folders in the embedded resource "filesystem."

By default, files that are embedded as resources will take precedence over files in the filesystem. If you would like the files in the filesystem to take precedence (that is, if you would like to allow the filesystem to "override" embedded files), you can set a key in the appSettings section of your web.config file that enables overrides:
For more information on virtual filesystems in ASP.NET, check out .

remarks.para: This override checks to see if the embedded resource file exists in memory. If so, this method will return . If not, it returns the value from the virtual path provider.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the instance.

remarks.para: The set of assemblies configured to provide embedded resource files are queried for attributes. For each one present, the associated embedded resource is added to the virtual filesystem served by this provider.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.GetConfiguredAssemblyNames
member.summary: Gets the names of the configured assemblies from configuration.
member.returns: A with the names of the configured assemblies that should participate in this path provider.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.MapResourceToWebApplication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Maps an embedded resource ID into a web application relative path (~/path).
member.param: The base namespace of the resource to map.
The fully qualified embedded resource path to map.
member.returns: The mapped path of the resource into the web application.

remarks.para: The is stripped from the front of the and all but the last period in the remaining is replaced with the directory separator character ('/'). Finally, that path is mapped into a web application relative path.

The filename being mapped must have an extension associated with it, and that extension may not have a period in it. Only one period will be kept in the mapped filename - others will be assumed to be directory separators. If a filename has multiple extensions (i.e., My.Custom.config), it will not map properly - it will end up being ~/My/Custom.config.
If does not occur at the start of the , an is thrown.

example.para: Given a of MyNamespace, this method will process as follows:

member.exception:
Thrown if or :
Is .
Start or end with period.
Contain two or more periods together (like MyNamespace..MySubnamespace).

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.ValidateResourcePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates an embedded resource path or namespace.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The path/namespace to validate.
member.exception:
Thrown if :
Is .
Start or end with period.
Contain two or more periods together (like MyNamespace..MySubnamespace).

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.FileHandledByBaseProvider(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a file should be handled by the base provider or if it should be handled by this provider.
member.param: The absolute path to the file to check.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.ProcessEmbeddedFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Reads in the embedded files from an assembly an processes them into the virtual filesystem.
member.param: The name of the to load and process.
member.exception: Thrown if the indicated by is not found.

remarks.para: The will be passed to so the associated assembly can be processed. If the assembly is not found, a is thrown.

Once the assembly is retrieved, it is queried for instances. For each one found, the associated resources are processed into virtual files that will be stored in
for later use.

member.name: P:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourcePathProvider.AllowOverrides
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if embedded files can be overridden.

remarks.para: This property uses the key to determine if overrides are allowed. If the key is present, it is parsed to a and that value is returned. If the key is not present or if any error occurs during the parsing, is returned.

member.value: A that contains all of the files served by this provider.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Services.SelfHostingService.CreateServiceBinding(System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a based on the specified .
member.param: The URI that is used to determine the type of to be created.
A boolean value that indicated whether security is to be enabled on the .
member.returns: An object if a valid is specified; otherwise null.
member.remarks:
This list shows all valid address schemes that can be specified in the :
Address Scheme Usage
http:// or http.soap11:// An of http.soap11://localhost:2929 will create an and update the to http://localhost:2929.
http.soap12:// An of http.soap12://localhost:2929 will create an and update the to http://localhost:2929.
http.duplex:// An of http.duplex://localhost:2929 will create an and update the to http://localhost:2929.
http.rest:// An of http.rest://localhost:2929 will create an and update the to http://localhost:2929.
net.tcp:// An of net.tcp://localhost:2929 will create an and leave the unchanged.
net.p2p:// An of net.p2p://localhost:2929 will create an and leave the unchanged.
net.pipe:// An of net.pipe://localhost:2929 will create an and leave the unchanged.
net.msmq:// An of net.msmq://localhost:2929 will create an and leave the unchanged.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Embedded.SecurityPortal
member.summary: Embedded web page used by secure ASP.NET web sites for security related tasks.
member.example:
Config file entries for customizing the page:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <configSections> <section name="categorizedSettings" type="TVA.Configuration.CategorizedSettingsSection, TVA.Core" /> </configSections> <categorizedSettings> <securityPortal> <add name="CompanyName" value="My Company" description="Name of the company." encrypted="false" /> <add name="CompanyLink" value="http://www.mycompany.com" description="Link to the company's web site." encrypted="false" /> <add name="CompanyLogo" value="~/images/MyCompanyLogo.png" description="Image file of the company's logo." encrypted="false" /> </securityPortal> </categorizedSettings> </configuration>

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceVirtualFile
member.summary: Represents a file object in embedded resource space.

remarks.para:
This type is used by the to serve embedded resources as virtual files. The properties on the file can be used to retrieve an embedded resource stream from the
at the appropriate
using reflection. As part of the interface, you can do this easily via .
For more information on embedded resource virtual filesystem usage, see

property.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute
member.summary: Attribute indicating the location of an embedded resource that should be served by the .

remarks.para: This attribute is used by the module/path provider to retrieve the list of embedded resources from an assembly that should be considered a part of the virtual filesystem.

example.para: Below is an example of what it might look like to embed a web form and a user control in an assembly to be served up with the :

member.name: F:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.m_resourceNamespace
member.summary:
Internal storage for the
property.

member.name: F:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.m_resourcePath
member.summary:
Internal storage for the
property.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The path to the embedded resource. Used to get the resource as a stream from the assembly.
The namespace the resource is in. This will generally be removed from the full resource path to calculate the "application path" for the embedded resource.
member.exception: Thrown if is or if it only consists of periods and/or spaces.

remarks.para: Both and will be processed to have leading and trailing periods and spaces removed. If ends up being empty, an is thrown. No exception is thrown if turns out empty.

example.para: If the is RootNS.SubNS.AppRoot.Folder.File.aspx and the is RootNS.SubNS.AppRoot, the virtual "path" to the embedded file will be Folder.File.aspx (which will be converted by the to ~/Folder/File.aspx).

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.RemoveMalformedEndChars(System.String)
member.summary: Removes leading and trailing dots and spaces from a string.
member.param: The to be cleaned up.
member.returns: A version of with leading and trailing dots and spaces removed.

member.name: F:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.MalformedEndCharExpression
member.summary: Regular expression indicating the characters that can't start or end a resource.

member.name: P:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.ResourceNamespace
member.summary: Gets the namespace for the embedded resource.
member.value: A with the embedded resource namespace.

remarks.para: This namespace will be removed from the full to create the virtual application path for the resource.

member.name: P:TVA.Web.Hosting.EmbeddedResourceFileAttribute.ResourcePath
member.summary: Gets the path to the embedded resource.
member.value: A with the full path to an embedded resource in the associated assembly.

remarks.para: This path will be used to retrieve the resource from the assembly and serve it up.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Embedded.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains embedded ASP.NET web pages and WCF web services that support the implementation of role-based security in .NET and non-.NET based development platforms.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.SecurityModule
member.summary: Represents an HTTP module that can be used to enable site-wide role-based security.
member.example:
Required config file entries:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <configuration> <configSections> <section name="categorizedSettings" type="TVA.Configuration.CategorizedSettingsSection, TVA.Core" /> </configSections> <categorizedSettings> <securityProvider> <add name="ApplicationName" value="SEC_APP" description="Name of the application being secured as defined in the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ConnectionString" value="Primary={Server=DB1;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True};Backup={Server=DB2;Database=AppSec;Trusted_Connection=True}" description="Connection string to be used for connection to the backend security datastore." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ProviderType" value="TVA.Security.SqlSecurityProvider, TVA.Security" description="The type to be used for enforcing security." encrypted="false" /> <add name="IncludedResources" value="*/*.*=*" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be secured along with role names." encrypted="false" /> <add name="ExcludedResources" value="*/WebResource.axd;*/SecurityPortal.aspx" description="Semicolon delimited list of resources to be excluded from being secured." encrypted="false" /> </securityProvider> <activeDirectory> <add name="PrivilegedDomain" value="" description="Domain of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedUserName" value="" description="Username of privileged domain user account." encrypted="false" /> <add name="PrivilegedPassword" value="" description="Password of privileged domain user account." encrypted="true" /> </activeDirectory> </categorizedSettings> <system.web> <authentication mode="Windows"/> <httpModules> <add name="SecurityModule" type="TVA.Web.SecurityModule, TVA.Web" /> </httpModules> </system.web> </configuration>

member.summary: Initializes the .
member.param: An object.

member.name: T:TVA.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBaseCollection
member.summary: A strongly typed where each element is a and is keyed off of the property.

remarks.para: The default constructor for this collection does a culture-invariant case-insensitive comparison on the keys. This allows for proper case-insensitive web-oriented behavior that is generally expected.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBaseCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that uses a case-insensitive comparer.

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBaseCollection.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that uses the specified equality comparer.
member.param: The implementation of the generic interface to use when comparing keys, or to use the default equality comparer for the type of the key, obtained from .

member.name: M:TVA.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBaseCollection.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that uses the specified equality comparer.
member.param: The implementation of the generic interface to use when comparing keys, or to use the default equality comparer for the type of the key, obtained from .

The number of elements the collection can hold without creating a lookup dictionary (0 creates the lookup dictionary when the first item is added), or ?1 to specify that a lookup dictionary is never created.

member.summary: Extracts the key from the specified element.
